name: Indus Hospital
mission:
Friends of Indus Hospital, Inc (FOIH) is a US-based 501(c)(3) registered charity. We strive to create awareness about the healthcare needs of underprivileged patients and raise funds to provide them with equitable care. By supporting healthcare efforts in Pakistan, FOIH is helping to ensure that vulnerable individuals have access to the healthcare they need, regardless of financial or other barriers.
Through annual fundraising initiatives, community events, and awareness drives, we seek to mobilize a strong tradition of community giving and a shared commitment to changing the paradigm of healthcare delivery in Pakistan.
FOIH is an initiative taken by Americans of Pakistani origin expatriates and supported by a wider community across the USA.
All donations given to FOIH are eligible for tax deduction under US law.
theoryOfChange: Friends of Indus Hospital (FOIH) demonstrates a strategic framework through its published 'Vision and Mission', 'FOIH Impact Reports', and 'FOIH Annual Reports'. The 'Vision and Mission' outlines their commitment to transforming Pakistan's healthcare landscape by providing free, quality healthcare and empowering underserved communities. The 'FOIH Impact Reports' section on their website lists various specific reports such as 'Cochlear Implant Report 2025', 'ClubFoot Report USA', and 'Impact Report: HCV Report 2025', indicating a structured approach to measuring and reporting on the outcomes of their programs. Furthermore, their implementing partner, Indus Hospital & Health Network (IHHN), outlines a strategic approach with '6 distinct areas of intervention, services, outreach, and expansion' in their 2022 Annual Report, which includes investing in a nationwide primary health network, building healthcare capacity, focusing on education and research, adopting a multi-sectoral approach, and fostering partnerships. Charity Navigator also assesses FOIH on 'Impact & Measurement', contributing 25% to their overall score, further suggesting a documented approach to measuring change.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://foihus.org/zakat (Source: https://foihus.org/zakat)

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high for donors seeking humanitarian causes, as the organization provides a transparent mechanism for Zakat contributions to support healthcare for the poor [1][3]. The high Charity Navigator score of 95.75/100 reflects a strong track record of governance and donor trust [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates high impact through direct service programs including prosthetic limb provision, neonatal care, and safe birth initiatives [4]. With a total revenue of $14,742,480 and a program expense ratio of 86.8%, the vast majority of funds directly support medical services for the underserved [2][4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Friends of Indus Hospital Inc supports the delivery of free, high-quality healthcare to underserved populations in Pakistan through a network of specialized medical facilities.
strengths: High financial efficiency with a program expense ratio of 86.8%
Strong accountability and transparency with a Charity Navigator score of 95.75/100
Low fundraising costs of only $0.11 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Friends of Indus Hospital Inc is a U.S.-based 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to supporting the Indus Hospital and Health Network's mission of providing premium healthcare at no cost to patients [4]. The organization is Zakat-eligible, maintaining a dedicated policy to ensure funds reach those in need according to Islamic principles [1].

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support high-quality, free healthcare in Pakistan through a transparent, zakat-eligible institution with low overhead.

Value high financial transparency (Platinum Candid Seal)
Prefer supporting direct medical services over advocacy
Interested in supporting established Pakistani health infrastructure
giving_considerations: Gifts support a large network rather than a single clinic
The organization operates with lean reserves
Impact is measured through service volume rather than RCTs
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fund medical research or those who prefer organizations with large endowment-style reserves.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The charity tracks <cite id="2">6 outcome metrics</cite> and has a clear theory of change, but lacks independent third-party evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: FOIH provides funding to the Indus Hospital & Health Network to remove financial barriers to healthcare, leading to improved health outcomes for the underserved.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that free medical treatments are resulting in long-term patient recovery and community health improvements.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The massive healthcare gap in Pakistan and FOIH's 24.1% growth rate indicate a high capacity to absorb and deploy new funds.

strengths.detail: The organization holds a <cite id="2">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and a <cite id="2">perfect 100/100 score for Culture & Accountability</cite> from Charity Navigator.
FOIH demonstrates remarkable fiscal discipline, spending only <cite id="2">$0.11 to raise every $1</cite> in donations, well below industry averages.
The charity utilizes a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 86.8%</cite> to fund direct healthcare services, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach patients.

strengths_deep_dive: Friends of Indus Hospital distinguishes itself through a robust governance structure and a commitment to financial integrity. With an <cite id="2">independent board comprising 100% of its members</cite>, the organization ensures objective oversight of its mission to support the Indus Hospital and Health Network. Their financial health is further evidenced by a <cite id="2">97/100 Impact & Measurement score</cite>, which reflects their ability to track and report on the medical services provided. Furthermore, the organization has demonstrated a <cite id="2">willingness to share feedback practices</cite> and outcome metrics, tracking <cite id="2">6 distinct outcome metrics</cite> through Candid to validate their effectiveness in the global health space.
rich_narrative.summary: Friends of Indus Hospital Inc (FOIH) serves as a critical financial lifeline for the Indus Hospital and Health Network, facilitating the delivery of <cite id="4">free, high-quality healthcare to underserved populations</cite> in Pakistan. The organization operates on the principle that healthcare is a fundamental right, supporting a network of specialized medical facilities that treat millions of patients regardless of their ability to pay. In the 2023 fiscal year, FOIH managed <cite id="4">$14,742,480 in total revenue</cite>, a figure that reflects a significant <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.1%</cite>. This growth underscores the increasing trust of the donor community in FOIH’s ability to scale its impact. The charity maintains a <cite id="2">95.75/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, placing it among the top-tier of international health nonprofits. Beyond general medical services, FOIH supports specialized programs including <cite id="2">childhood cancer treatment, safe birth initiatives, and neonatal care</cite>. By focusing on direct service delivery, the organization ensures that contributions are converted into tangible medical outcomes, such as surgeries, diagnostic tests, and long-term treatments for chronic illnesses.
